intro: Erodium bertramii, commonly known as the Bertram's commonweed, is a flowering plant in the family Leguminosae. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in disturbed soils and arid environments. The plant has trifoliate leaves and produces small, clustered pink or purple flowers. Its seed pods are slender and twisted, typical of the genus Erodium. It is native to southern Africa and is often found in coastal and inland regions.
